info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 30 at 3:26PM EDT until March 30 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Miami-Dade.
* WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 326 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Miami, Hialeah, Fort Lauderdale, Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Coral Springs, Pompano Beach, Davie, Miami Beach, Plantation, Sunrise, Deerfield Beach, Tamarac, Margate, Coral Gables, Key Biscayne, Lighthouse Point, Lauderdale-By-The-Sea and Surfside. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
